alert.note: Alert for Eastern Magic Valley; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 6:57PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Bannock, central Power and southwestern Bingham Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 657 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near American Falls, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pocatello, American Falls, Neeley, American Falls Reservoir, Chubbuck, Aberdeen, Fort Hall Buffalo Lodge, Fort Hall Townsite, Springfield, Rockford, Fort Hall Bannock Creek Lodge, Pingree, Pocatello Airport, and Sterling. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near American Falls Reservoir, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Strong winds will create rough chop. Lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
